main-config-title.name: Main Config
main-config-title.description: The mod's <cy>main config</c>, enable or disable the mod and set the sprite to use!

enable-sonicmod.name: Enable Mod (READ INFO!!)
enable-sonicmod.description:
Allows for <cy>toggling</c> the mod's functions <cg>on</c>/<cr>off</c> without the need for disabling the entire mod and restarting the game. 

 <co>Will need a level restart on change if</c> <cs>Allow Dynamic Soft-toggle update</c> <co>is disabled</c>! 
<cr>Please make sure to restart the level you're playing after switching this setting to avoid issues!!</c>

selected-sprite.name: Game Sprite (READ INFO)
selected-sprite.description:
Chooses which sonic game sprites' the mod will use. classic1 is Sonic 1, classic2 is Sonic 2, etc! 

 <cr>Requires level restart to properly apply when changed mid-gameplay if</c> <co>Allow Dynamic Max Frame Updating</c> <cr>is disabled</c>

sfx-config-title.name: SFX Configs
sfx-config-title.description: All configs related to the <cy>SFX feature</c> of the mod. <cl>Enable, use globally, and customize the sound to use for each event!</c>

enable-sfx.name: Enable SFX
enable-sfx.description: <cg>Enables</c> playing <cl>Sonic sound effects</c> on certain in-game events!

global-sfx.name: Global SFX
global-sfx.description:
Defines whether or not should sound effects be played <cy>regardless of gamemode</c>.

 <cg>If on</c>, Sonic SFX will play on <cp>any gamemode</c>, <cr>if off</c> (by default) SFX will <cj>only play when in Robot gamemode</c>, aka, <cl>when Sonic is present.</c>

disable-inclassic.name: Disable SFX in Classic Mode
disable-inclassic.description: Disables the Sonic SFX from playing when in Classic Mode.

jump-sfx.name: Jump SFX
jump-sfx.description: The Sound Effect to play on <cl>Robot Jump.</c>

orb-sfx.name: Orb SFX
orb-sfx.description: The Sound Effect to play on <cl>Orb use.</c>

dash-start-sfx.name: Dash Orb Start SFX
dash-start-sfx.description: The Sound Effect to play when <cl>a dash orb is used.</c>

dash-stop-sfx.name: Dash Orb Stop SFX
dash-stop-sfx.description: The Sound Effect to play when <cl>a dash orb is released.</c>

pad-sfx.name: Pad SFX
pad-sfx.description:
The Sound Effect to play when <cl>a bump pad is used.</c> 

 <co>(Doesn't play on Spider & Blue pads)</c>

compat-config-title.name: Compat & Accessibility
compat-config-title.description:
Configurations related to <cg>ensuring compatibility with other mods.</c> 

 <cr>Read the info for each before changing them so you don't accidentally break anything please!</c>

disable-compat.name: Disable createRobot hiding
disable-compat.description:
<cr>Disables</c> the compatibility option that hides the robot batch node & sprite in the createRobot function. 

 <cj>This option</c> <cg>fixes</c> <cj>compatibility with Globed players</c>, but <cr>WILL break with mods like Separate Dual Icons and/or Randomize Icon or Death.</c> 
 <cs>Please use carefully!</c> (Default: off)

dynamic-toggle.name: Allow Dynamic Soft-toggle update
dynamic-toggle.description:
Allows for the soft toggle to dynamically enable/disable sonic without the need for restarting the level. 

 <cr>Please note that this option checks for the presence of the Sonic Sprite on Player Update, so it MIGHT affect performance in some way FOR SOME!!</c> It's recommended to only enable if restarting the level is too much of a tiring task for you. 
 <cs>Please use carefully!</c>

dynamic-frames.name: Allow Dynamic Max Frame Updating
dynamic-frames.description:
Allows for being able to switch sprites in the middle of playing levels and have their max frames amount update live as well, fixing the occasional missing texture issues and having some smoother animations (like mania) not fully playing out as they should. 

 <cr>Please note that this option sets the max frame times on Player Update, so it MIGHT affect performance in some way FOR SOME!!</c> It's recommended to only enable if restarting the level is too much of a tiring task for you. 
 <cs>Please use carefully!</c>

extras-title.name: Extras
extras-title.description: Extra features that can be enabled or disabled to enhance the mod's experience. <cl>Read the info for each before changing them!</c>

sonic-ball.name: Sonic Ball
sonic-ball.description: Enables the Sonic Ball feature, which will show your currently selected character's rolling sprite in the ball gamemode!

sonic-cube.name: Sonic Cube
sonic-cube.description:
Enables the Sonic Cube feature, which will also show Sonic in the cube gamemode. 

 <cr>Although mostly functional, might cause some issues if enabled, aside from being overall confusing, since there won't be any noticeable difference between cube and Robot.</c> 

 <cs>Use at your own risk!</c>

jumpsfx-incube.name: Jump SFX in Cube
jumpsfx-incube.description:
Enables the Jump SFX to play in the cube gamemode if Sonic Cube is enabled. 

 <cr>Can, obviously, get very annoying to hear the sound THAT much. Up to you if you want to enable it!</c>

name: Sonic Robot
description: Mod that turns the robot gamemode into Sonic!
